text: Sheikh Chérif Ousmane Madani Haïdara is a religious figure in Mali who has been the president of the High Islamic Council of Mali since April 2019. He is a follower of the Maliki school of IslamHolder, Gilles. "Chérif Ousmane Madani Haidara and the Islamic Movement Ansar Dine. A Popular Malian Reformism in Search of Autonomy", Cahiers d’études africaines, vol. no 206-207, no. 2, 2012, pp. 389-425. and a Sufi. In 1991, Haïdara established the Sufi-based Islamic movement Ansar Dine (also written Ançar Dine) - not to be confused with the terrorist organization Ansar Dine operating in the north of Mali. The movement is strong in southern Mali, the Ivory Coast, Burkina Faso, and with Malian diaspora. ==References== Category:Malian Sufis Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
title: Chérif Ousmane Madani Haïdara
